the air
The air. It is an insubstantial object full of oxygen which you breathe in to keep your body functioning. If you didn't know that you should be ashamed of yourself.
The air. It is an insubstantial object full of oxygen which you breathe in to keep your body functioning. If you didn't know that you should be ashamed of yourself.
large snowdrift
A substantial drift of powder-white snow has amassed near here. It appears quite deep, you are certain that a few well-rounded snowballs can be snatched from it.

dawn.drizzle: The dawn light streams through a haze of miniature raindrops.
dawn.dry: The sky is streaked in the multi-colored hues of dawn.
dawn.snow: The multi-colored hues of the dawn sky are dimmed and twisted by copious amounts of fluffy white clouds.

morning.drizzle: The morning sky is filled with a light drizzle.
morning.dry: A crisp morning lights the world.
morning.cold: A very crisp, cold morning lights the world.

midday.drizzle: The sun pierces the heavens and creates circular rainbows, marking the midday sky.
midday.snow: Midday has arrived although barely noticeable due to the large, white clouds conquering the heavens.

afternoon.spring: The warmth of a spring afternoon begins to warm the ground.
afternoon.winter: The frigid skies of a winter afternoon.

Base:Description.dusk: Dusk creeps over the land in dulled hues of grey.

evening.dry: The evening skies bring with them the appearance of the first stars.
evening.drizzle: The evening sky holds ghost-white wisps of clouds that sprinkle the earth in a light drizzle.
evening.snow: The evening skies hide the stars behind the ominous clouds.

Base:Description.midnight: Midnight embraces the world in its dark cloak.
Base:Description.aftermidnight: The end of night nears and dawn will soon arrive.

Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the falling snow
Little crystal flakes of frozen water are falling from the sky. It is called snow.
Yes, snow is falling.
a snowdrift
A drift of snow has piled up near here. Although not large, it may be enough for quite a few well-rounded snowballs.
A drift of snow has piled up near here.
patch of freshly tilled soil
The patch of fresh soil is a rich, brown color with an earthy smell. It is large enough for a single plant to be planted there.
the stars

Base:Description.day: The stars are hidden by the light of the sun.
The stars are hidden by the light of the sun.

Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the sunmoon

day.spring: The spring day is warmed but a bright yellow sun.
day.snow: It is the sun, attempting to shine through the clouds.

Base:Description.dawn: The sun begins begins attempts to warm the world for it is dawn.
Base:Description.morning: The yellow sun makes for a softly lit morning.

midday.spring: Spring brings to you a middle of day that is warm and comfortable.
midday.summer: The midday sun is hot and powerful. Rays of warmth envelop the lands.
midday.winter: The midday sun barely warms the world as winter takes hold of the land.

Base:Description.afternoon: The sun has begun its descent, its heat is waning.
Base:Description.dusk: The sun hits the horizon and pulls back its bright rays to leave the world in hues of grey and shadow. The moon makes its first appearance of the evening.
Base:Description.evening: The moon begins its rise into the night sky. Stars can be seen as they peek around the fading light.The stars are obscured by snow-filled clouds.
Base:Description.midnight: Mid of night has brought the moon to the peak of its arc. Many brilliant stars share the dark canopy above.The stars are fully obscured by the snow-filled skies.
Base:Description.aftermidnight: The moon is in descent and the stars begin to fade. The sun has almost come full circle and prepares to rise.

air around you is thick and hazy with fog. \| The horizon is masked by thick fingers of dense fog as dawn illuminates the area. \| \ \{ The air is crisp and cold, the scent of autumn rich and heady. \| The cold air is tinged with the promise of frost as the harvest season colors the distant foliage with brilliant colors. \| A frost-tinged red autumn leaf flutters in from somewhere distant. \} \ bite of cold, a warning of the winter season to come. \| The air is crisp and biting cold, heavy with the scent of rich autumn leaves. \| Brisk cold air sends a shiver down the spine as the autumn cascade of red and yellow leaves across the ground before you. \| Softly shifting over the skin, the autumn breeze carries with it aromas of cider and apples. \} \ \} \ \ \{ Brilliant reds and deep purples color the sky as the sun retreats toward the western horizon. \| The haunting cry of geese in the distance heralds the arrival of the harvest season. \| The rich colors of the sunset fill the area with rays of russet and gold light. \| The brisk autumn air fills the surroundings with scents of dried leaves and damp earth. \| \ \{ The sky overhead is clear and colored in hues of auburn, of deep purple purple and vibrant red. \| Nary a cloud to be seen, the sky is clear and colorful as the setting sun brings a faint chill to the air. \} \ \| \ \{ The approaching nightfall brings a crisp cool to the air. \| Scents of the harvest season fill the mild air around you. \| Shadows grow longer as the sun sets, a faint chill harkening the arrival of the harvest season. \| The last clear sky above robbing all warmth from the air. \} \ \| \ \{ The air is heavy with the scent of frost, crisp and biting cold. \| Your breath, visible in the dark shadow of the late night, billows X[S] \{The birds take flight from nearby trees and streak northward in fear.\|Skinks start ducking into small, unnoticed holes and burrows.\|At corner of your eye you think you just saw a small mass of spiders scurrying away.\|Large work-lizards pulling carts and carriages seem unruly and agitated.\}

X[S] \{A small group of slaves attempt to clear a path in the highly-stacked snow with shovels so that carriages can continue to pass through.\|A rambunctious group of boys fly through the area, kicking up snow with their boots. One of them turns suddenly to throw a compact snowball at an unexpecting loiterer.\|Large chunks of snow slough off the main blanket to lazily slump against the ground.\|Large snowflakes fall slowly from the sky, blanketing everything in a white dust.\|An icy breeze cruises through the area, reminding all of the former storm and the present cold.\|Your legs become heavy as you try to wade through the thick layers of snow upon the ground.\|The audible crunching of shoes upon snow can be heard as people trudge slowly through the area.\|An old male slave scrapes a pathway in the snow so people can more easily traverse the area.\|A fat woman curses aloud as she attempts to plant one of her feet upon the ground and slips instead. Her skirt flies up and over her head, yet in her rage she manages to recover her footing before storming embarrassedly out of the area.\|A frail old man attempts to make his way through the snow, but becomes completely engulfed in the mass around him.\|The snow finds your waist in some of the deeper areas, sneaking uninvitedly into your legwear.\|A group of merchants chat nearby and discuss the possibility of selling iced drinks to the populace. They seem fairly certain it would be a welcome produce.\|Snow decorates the surroundings in a solid and thick sheet of white. The area is nothing short of a winter wonderland.\}

X[S] \{A thin layer of snow delicately clings to the ground, marking the area with the first signs of winter.\|Small scatters of snowflakes lazily twirl down from the sky to nestle in the hair of loitering bystanders.\|A gentle flurry of snow drifts through the area to sparsely decorate the surroundings in a small spattering of white wonder.\|Small snow tufts fall from the winter clouds to gently splat upon nearby surfaces.\|A chilly winter breeze blows through accompanied by a slow-falling stream of pure white snow from the heavens.\|A soft shower of snow falls from the sky to lightly blanket the ground.\|Quiet thuds can be heard all around as small clods of snow connect with the ground. The delicate white blanket continues to grow beneath the wintry sky.\|A collection of fragile snowflakes flutter down from the heavens before merging seamlessly into the thin blanket of snow upon the ground.\|A soft, icy breeze ruffles up the snow covering the nearby buildings, sending it swirling about in a whimsical dance.\|Snow continues to build upon the ground; the blanket growing increasingly thicker.\|A litter of snowflakes delicately drop from the sky to tranquilly collide in a splash of white with the nearby rooftops.\|Delicate streams of snow swirl here-and-there, weightlessly dancing in the loving embrace of the winter wind.\|The falling snowflakes fall against your clothing to subtly deliver a bit of moisture and coldness.\}

X[S] \{Howling winds blow through the area, furiously shaking the rooftops and nearby objects as they pass.\|Endless scores of snowflakes cascade rapidly down from the sky to abruptly collide with surrounding objects.\|A crazy flurry of snow crashes down from the heavens to cover the area in a thick cloak of stark white.\|Large flakes of snow continuously pour from the winter clouds, hindering eyesight almost completely.\|A turbulent winter breeze blasts through the area, accompanied by an abusive flow of substantial snow from the heavens.\|A massive shower of snow gushes from the sky to crash into the high-growing piles of white upon the ground.\|Audible thuds and thumps can be heard everywhere as large clusters of snow tumble gracelessly onto the ground.
